# Mini style guide (1-pager)

**Tone:** Formal, clear **MSA**, instructional. No dialect, no slang, no transliterated tech words unless noted.

**Numbers & Symbols:** Use **1,2,3â€¦**, **+ / â€“**, **â†’**. Stick to SI: **kWh, W, Â°C, mÂ², %**. Put a non-breaking space before units when possible.

**Acronyms:** First mention â€œArabic term (EN ACRONYM)â€, then acronym alone.

**Instruction chains:** In Arabic (RTL), keep steps visually coherent. If using arrows, ensure they point **â†’** as the readerâ€™s eye moves **right-to-left** (i.e., last step appears at the **left**). Keep verbs in the **imperative** for steps.

**Tables:** Use tables for option sets, specs, pros/cons. One row = one option. Columns: *Ø§Ù„Ø·Ø±ÙŠÙ‚Ø© | Î”U | Ø§Ù„ØªÙƒÙ„ÙØ©/Ù…Â² | Ù†Ù‚Ø§Ø· Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù†ØªØ¨Ø§Ù‡*.

**Terminology register:** Prefer standard, unambiguous terms (see glossary). Avoid words with unintended meanings (e.g., â€œÙ…Ø³ÙƒÙˆÙ†Ø©â€).

**Micro-edits checklist:**  
- [ ] Numbers unified to 1,2,3â€¦  
- [ ] Units & symbols consistent and present  
- [ ] Arrows point in correct RTL flow  
- [ ] Acronyms defined once  
- [ ] No slang/transliteration unless bracketed (Package)  
- [ ] Steps use imperative; labels use nouns  
- [ ] Dense lines converted to bullets/tables
